meanings.definition: Of or relating to Dadaism, an art movement of the European avant-garde in the early 20th century.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a dadaistic painting that challenged traditional art norms.
meanings.sent2: Her dadaistic approach to sculpture was both unconventional and thought-provoking.
meanings.sent3: The dadaistic performance art piece left the audience puzzled but intrigued.
meanings.sent4: His dadaistic interpretation of reality was a bold statement against conformity.
meanings.sent5: The dadaistic exhibit at the museum was a chaotic blend of colors and shapes.

meanings.definition: Characterized by absurdity, irrationality, and anti-establishment principles.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's jokes had a dadaistic humor that made everyone laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The movie's plot took a dadaistic turn, leaving the audience in disbelief.
meanings.sent3: The dadaistic behavior of the clown at the circus was both entertaining and unpredictable.
meanings.sent4: Her dadaistic fashion sense always turned heads wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The dadaistic protest against the new law caught the attention of the entire city.

meanings.definition: Resembling or inspired by the principles of Dadaism.
meanings.sent1: The play had a dadaistic vibe that resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent2: His dadaistic writing style challenged traditional literary conventions.
meanings.sent3: The dadaistic music video was a creative blend of visuals and sounds.
meanings.sent4: The artist's dadaistic sculptures were a unique interpretation of modern art.
meanings.sent5: The fashion designer's collection had a dadaistic influence that set it apart from the rest.
